Key Match Events: India win by 24 runs to reach semi-finals and leave Australia on brink of exit, needing Bangladesh to beat Afghanistan.
India post 205-5 after Rohit smacks a sublime 92 off 41 balls.
Axar takes stunning one-handed, leaping catch to dismiss Marsh.
Australia only reach 181-7 despite Head's 76 off 43.
Kuldeep Yadav's wicket of Glenn Maxwell changed the course of the game, completely halting Australia's momentum.
Kuldeep took 2-24, Arshdeep Singh took 3-37 with a wicket apiece for Jasprit Bumrah and Axar Patel in a fine all-round effort.
India captain and player of the match Rohit Sharma: 'That's what I have to do at the top of the order, see what the bowlers are trying to do and play accordingly.'
Australia captain Mitchell Marsh: 'Yeah, it's so disappointing. We know we still have a chance to make the semis but today, India got the better of us.'
Post-Match Reflections: India captain and player of the match Rohit Sharma: 'That's what I have to do at the top of the order, see what the bowlers are trying to do and play accordingly.'
Australia captain Mitchell Marsh: 'Yeah, it's so disappointing. We know we still have a chance to make the semis but today, India got the better of us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India will face England in their semi-final in Guyana on Thursday.
Australia are not mathematically out of this but their fate is now out of their own hands. If Afghanistan beat Bangladesh tomorrow, Australia will be knocked out.
